IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The mission of the American Lung Association in California (ALAC) is to save lives by improving lung health and preventing lung diseases.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of the American Lung Association in California (ALAC) is to save lives by improving lung health and preventing lung diseases.
IRS990.Description: Tobacco Control Through legislative efforts, the American Lung Association of California has been successful in reducing exposure to environmental tobacco smoke and securing funding for health education and research in the area of tobacco control The Association provides tobacco prevention programs aimed at children and youth, provides smoking cessation programs, education, resources, and referrals, and operates "The Center for Tobacco Policy and Organizing," which serves as a resource to local tobacco control efforts throughout the state.

Activity2.Description: Asthma Program & Other Lung DiseaseThe Association funds research on the prevention and treatment of asthma and other lung diseases. It provides asthma education to children, parents, and teachers through the Asthma Friendly Schools Initiative, Open Airways for Schools, and other programs. The Association is a leader in asthma coalitions at the local and statewide levels, and works with state agencies and the legislature to promote access to and the delivery of adequate health care services for people with asthma and other lung diseases.

Activity3.Description: Other Programs provided by ALAC include:Program Name: Expenses: Revenues:Environmental Health 629,429 Community Health Services 14,895 Other Lung Diseases 980,880 195,906

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALAC makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Based on ALAC's performance management process, other officers and key employees are evaluated by their managers. Compensation is then determined based on compensation guidelines set by comparative data published in research journals for similar organizations.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The conflict of interest policy in the American Lung Association in California's (ALAC's) bylaws are reviewed at a minimum, annually. It is also strictly monitored and enforced through operating procedures outlined in ALAC's Standard Operations Procedures manual.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is prepared by an outside accounting firm. It is first reviewed by management and then submitted electronically to the Audit Committee members for comments and changes. After agreed changes are made, it is submitted to the organization's governing body for final review and approval before filing with the Internal Revenue Service.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 4: Description of Significant Changes to Organizational Documents
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Articles of Incorporation for ALAC were amended and restated to reflect the organization's name change from the American Lung Association of California to the American Lung Association in California.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part V, Line 3b: Reason For Not Filing Form 990-T
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AlAC had unrelated gross income of $57,633 from renting office suites. Form 990-T is not required to be filed because the said real property is not debt-financed.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
